abstract: Hassan Yebda (born 14 May 1984) is an Algerian professional footballer who plays for Udinese Calcio on loan from Granada CF in Spain and the Algeria national team, as a central midfielder.During his professional career he played in France, Portugal, England, Italy and Spain, representing a host of clubs.Yebda is a former French youth international and was part of the team that won the 2001 U-17 World Championship. He opted to play for Algeria at senior level in August 2009, taking advantage of FIFAâ€™s new ruling which allowed him to change his national allegiance despite being older than 21 years of age, and represented the latter national team at the 2010 World Cup and the 2010 Africa Cup of Nations.
